intro: Castanopsis sieboldii subsp. lutchuensis, commonly known as the Lushan tanoak, is a member of the Fagaceae family and is native to southern China. It is a broadleaf evergreen tree that can grow up to 20 meters tall, characterized by its dense, glossy dark green leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers followed by edible, chestnut-like fruits that are an important food source for various wildlife. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in subtropical forest ecosystems.
